general_requirements.statewide_program_name: Building and electrical permits required. DEQ PBR program does not regulate residential solar. Contact local government planning and zoning. PE stamps typically required for systems >12 kW.

interconnection.net_metering_details: Net metering available for systems up to 25 kW residential. Dominion Energy Virginia and Appalachian Power primary utilities.

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: Virginia Code 67-701 limits HOA restrictions on solar. Cannot increase cost >5% or reduce efficiency >10%.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Virginia historic districts may require additional review.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: Coastal areas have enhanced wind requirements. Design wind speeds 100-130 mph.
special_considerations.snow_load_requirements: Mountain areas may have snow loads 20-40 psf.

licensing.license_type: Virginia DPOR Class A or B contractor license required depending on project value.

notes: Rapidly growing solar market. Virginia Clean Economy Act driving solar deployment. Local permitting varies significantly by jurisdiction. Solar Permit Map available at solarpermitmap.coopercenter.org.

jurisdictions.name: Virginia Beach
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Coastal wind load requirements. Standard IFC setbacks.
special_requirements: Coastal wind load calcs may be required
jurisdictions.notes: Standard VA permitting. Coastal location may require wind load calculations.

jurisdictions.name: Richmond
jurisdictions.notes: Standard VA permitting. Dominion Energy serves the area.
